info.title: Voucherify API - Templates
info.description: Voucherify promotion engine REST API. Please see https://docs.voucherify.io/docs for more details. - Endpoints tagged with 'Templates'

get.description:
Lists all campaign templates available in the project.

> ðŸ“˜ Campaign Templates â€“ Documentation
>
>Read the [Campaign Templates documentation](https://support.voucherify.io/article/620-campaign-templates) to learn more about this feature.

parameters.name: starting_after_id
parameters.description: A cursor for pagination. It retrieves the campaign templates created after a template with the given ID.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Sorts the results using one of the filtering options, where the dash - preceding a sorting option means sorting in a descending order.

parameters.name: include_total
parameters.description: If set to `true`, the response returns the number of all campaign templates, regardless of the applied filters or limits. Set to `false` by default.

200.description: Returns a dictionary of campaign template objects. The templates are returned by creation date by default. The most recent objects appear last unless specified otherwise with the `order` parameter.

post.description:
Creates a template for a discount or gift campaign, or a promotion tier.

A template stores campaign configuration **without** the following details:
- Campaign name
- Category
- Code count

The following elements are not supported by campaign templates:
- Redeeming API keys
- Redeeming users
- Customer loyalty tier
- Static segments

> ðŸ‘ Promotion Tiers and Campaign Templates
>
>You can create a campaign template out of a promotion tier. Promotion tiers are converted to a discount campaign with the `DISCOUNT_COUPON` type. You can use this template to create:
>- Discount campaign,
>- Promotion tier.

> ðŸ“˜ Campaign Templates â€“ Documentation
>
>Read the [Campaign Templates documentation](https://support.voucherify.io/article/620-campaign-templates) to learn more about this feature.

requestBody.description: Provide details for a campaign template

200.description: Returns the details of a created campaign template.

400.description: Returns an error if the payload is missing required properties in the request or the campaign includes features not supported by campaign templates.

value.message: Campaign of the given type is not supported by campaign template

404.description: Returns an error if a resource is not found.

value.details: Cannot find campaign with id camp_Tq8OnIpBAeHNY7KMM0rE5MB

get.description:
Retrieves a campaign template available in the project.

> ðŸ“˜ Campaign Templates â€“ Documentation
>
>Read the [Campaign Templates documentation](https://support.voucherify.io/article/620-campaign-templates) to learn more about this feature.

200.description: Returns the details about a campaign template.

value.name: Happy Hours Template
value.description: Template for a Happy Hours campaign with discount coupons.

404.description: Returns an error if a resource is not found.

value.details: Cannot find campaign_template with id camp_tpl_zLtn2H9fgcG3NwO7t4PAfHc

put.description:
Updates the name or description of the campaign template.

> ðŸ“˜ Campaign Templates â€“ Documentation
>
>Read the [Campaign Templates documentation](https://support.voucherify.io/article/620-campaign-templates) to learn more about this feature.

requestBody.description: Provide the new name or description for the campaign template

200.description: Returns the details of an updated campaign template.

value.name: Happy Hours Winter Template
value.description: Template for a Happy Hours campaign with discount coupons for the winter season.

400.description: Returns an error if the payload is invalid.

404.description: Returns an error if a resource is not found.

value.details: Cannot find campaign_template with id camp_tpl_zLtn2H9fgcG3NwO7t4PAfHc

409.description: Returns an error if a campaign template with the same name already exists.

value.details: Duplicated campaign_template exists with name Campaign_Template_01

delete.description:
Deletes the campaign template permanently.

> ðŸ“˜ Campaign Templates â€“ Documentation
>
>Read the [Campaign Templates documentation](https://support.voucherify.io/article/620-campaign-templates) to learn more about this feature.

204.description: Returns no content if deletion is successful.

404.description: Returns an error if a resource is not found.

value.details: Cannot find campaign_template with id camp_tpl_zLtn2H9fgcG3NwO7t4PAfHc

post.description:
Creates a campaign out of a campaign template.

To create a campaign, you need to provide the name in the request, while other fields are optional. If no other fields are sent, the configuration from the template will be used.

You can send new values of the fields listed below to replace the settings saved in the template. However, you cannot assign an existing validation rule or create a new one in the request. If the template has a validation rule, a new validation rule is always created for the campaign. When the campaign has been created, then you can:
- [Update the validation rule](ref:update-validation-rule),
- [Unassign the validation rule](ref:delete-validation-rule-assignment),
- [Assign an existing validation rule](ref:create-validation-rule-assignment).

> ðŸ‘ Promotion Tiers and Campaign Templates
>
>You can create a campaign template out of a promotion tier. Promotion tiers are converted to a discount campaign with the `DISCOUNT_COUPON` type. You can use this template to create:
>- Discount campaign
>- [Promotion tier](ref:add-tier-from-template)

> ðŸ“˜ Campaign Templates â€“ Documentation
>
>Read the [Campaign Templates documentation](https://support.voucherify.io/article/620-campaign-templates) to learn more about this feature.

requestBody.description: Only `name` is required. The rest of the fields will overwrite the template configuration.

200.description: Returns the details about the created campaign and about the resources that have been created out of the template and added to the project.

404.description: Returns an error if a resource is not found.

value.details: Cannot find campaign_template with id camp_tpl_zLtn2H9fgcG3NwO7t4PAfHc

409.description: Returns an error if a campaign with the same name already exists.

value.details: Duplicated campaign exists with name CampaignFromTemplate-01

post.description:
Creates a promotion tier out of a discount campaign template and adds it to an existing promotion campaign.

To add a promotion tier to a campaign, you need to provide the name in the request and the campaign ID. Other fields are optional. If no other fields are sent, the configuration from the template will be used.

You can send new values of the fields listed below to replace the settings saved in the template. However, you cannot assign an action or an existing validation rule or create a new one in the request. If the template has a validation rule, a new validation rule is always created for the promotion tier. When the promotion tier has been created, then you can:
- [Update the validation rule](ref:update-validation-rule),
- [Unassign the validation rule](ref:delete-validation-rule-assignment),
- [Assign an existing validation rule](ref:create-validation-rule-assignment).

> ðŸ‘ Promotion Tiers and Campaign Templates
>
>You can create a campaign template out of a promotion tier. Promotion tiers are converted to a discount campaign with the `DISCOUNT_COUPON` type. You can use this template to create:
>- [Discount campaign](ref:create-campaign-from-template)
>- Promotion tier

> ðŸ“˜ Campaign Templates â€“ Documentation
>
>Read the [Campaign Templates documentation](https://support.voucherify.io/article/620-campaign-templates) to learn more about this feature.

requestBody.description: Only `name` and `campaign_id` are required. The rest of the fields will overwrite the template configuration.

200.description: Returns the details about the added promotion tier and about the resources that have been created out of the template and added to the project.

404.description: Returns an error if a resource is not found.

value.details: Cannot find campaign_template with id camp_tpl_zLtn2H9fgcG3NwO7t4PAfHc

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Limits the number of objects to be returned. The limit can range between 1 and 100 items. If no limit is set, it returns 10 items.

conditions.description: Data filters used to narrow down the data records to be returned in the result.

$in.description: Array of resource values that should be included in the results (multiple values).

$not_in.description: Array of resource values that should be included in the results (multiple values).

$is.description: Value is exactly this value (single value).

$has_value.description: Value is NOT null. The value for this parameter is an empty string.

$is_unknown.description: Value is null. The value for this parameter is an empty string.

$starts_with.description: Value starts with the specified string.

$ends_with.description: Value ends with the specified string.

TemplatesCampaignsListResponseBody.title: Templates Campaign Template List Response Body

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about campaign templates.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the JSON property that contains the array of campaign templates.

data.description: Dictionary that contains an array of campaign templates.

total.description: Total number of templates, regardless of the applied query parameters. Displayed only if the `include_total` query paremeter is set to `true`.

has_more.description: As query results are always limited (by the limit parameter), the `has_more` flag indicates if there are more records for given filter parameters. This lets you know if you can run another request to get more records returned in the results.

more_starting_after.description: Returns an ID that can be used to return another page of results. Use the template ID in the `starting_after_id` query parameter to display another page of the results starting after the template with that ID.

TemplatesCampaignsCreateRequestBody.title: Templates Campaigns Template Create Request Body

campaign_id.description: Unique identifier of the campaign that will create a template. It must be an ID of an existing discount or gift card campaign. It cannot be passed when `promotion_tier_id` has value. Required when the `promotion_tier_id` is not passed or it is `null`.

promotion_tier_id.description: Unique identifier of the promotion tier that will create a template. It cannot be passed when `campaign_id` has value. Required when the `campaign_id` is not passed or it is `null`.

TemplatesCampaignsCreateTemplateResponse.title: Templates Campaign Template Create Response Body

key.description: Short string describing the kind of error which occurred.

message.description: A human-readable message providing a short description of the error.

details.description: A human-readable message providing more details about the error.

request_id.description: This ID is useful when troubleshooting and/or finding the root cause of an error response by our support team.

key.description: Short string describing the kind of error which occurred.

message.description: A human-readable message providing a short description of the error.

details.description: A human-readable message providing more details about the error.

request_id.description: This ID is useful when troubleshooting and/or finding the root cause of an error response by our support team.

resource_id.description: Unique resource ID that can be used in another endpoint to get more details.

error.description: Includes additional information about the error.

message.description: The message configured by the user in a validation rule.

Junction.title: Junction
Junction.description: Logical Operator Between Filters. Filter by conditions set on the `junction` parameter indicating how the `conditions` should be accounted for in the query. An `AND` is an all-inclusive logical operator, meaning the `AND` operator displays a record if **ALL** the conditions separated by AND are TRUE, while  an `OR` operator displays a record if **ANY** of the conditions separated by OR is TRUE.

FilterConditionsString.title: Filter by conditions
FilterConditionsString.description: Data filters used to narrow down the data records to be returned in the result.

$in.description: Array of resource values that should be included in the results (multiple values).

$not_in.description: Array of resource values that should be included in the results (multiple values).

$is.description: Value is exactly this value (single value).

$has_value.description: Value is NOT null. The value for this parameter is an empty string.

$is_unknown.description: Value is null. The value for this parameter is an empty string.

$starts_with.description: Value starts with the specified string.

$ends_with.description: Value ends with the specified string.

$not_contain.description: Value does NOT include the specified string.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign template was last updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

TemplatesCampaignsNameDescription.title: Update Campaign Template Request
TemplatesCampaignsNameDescription.description: Request body for updating a campaign template.

name.description: User-defined name of the campaign template. It must be unique.

description.description: User-defined description of the campaign template.

CampaignTemplateBase.title: Campaign Template Base
CampaignTemplateBase.description: Stores details about a campaign template.

id.description: Unique identifier of the campaign template. It is assigned by Voucherify.

name.description: User-defined name of the campaign template.

description.description: User-defined description of the campaign template.

campaign_type.description: Type of the campaign used to create the campaign template. Templates created from a promotion tier are converted to `DISCOUNT_COUPONS`.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign template was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

CampaignsCreateBase.title: Campaign Create Schema Base
CampaignsCreateBase.description: Base body schema for creating a campaign

description.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the campaign such as a campaign description and details.

type.description:
Defines whether the campaign can be updated with new vouchers after campaign creation or if the campaign consists of generic (standalone) voucherss.

- `AUTO_UPDATE`: the campaign is dynamic, i.e. vouchers will generate based on set criteria
-  `STATIC`: vouchers need to be manually published

join_once.description: If this value is set to `true`, customers will be able to join the campaign only once. For loyalty campaigns, it's forced to `true`, even if `join_once: false` is passed in the request.

auto_join.description: Indicates whether customers will be able to auto-join a loyalty campaign if any earning rule is fulfilled.

use_voucher_metadata_schema.description: Flag indicating whether the campaign is to use the voucher's metadata schema instead of the campaign metadata schema.

vouchers_count.description: Total number of unique vouchers in campaign (size of campaign).

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

activity_duration_after_publishing.description: Defines the amount of time the vouchers will be active after publishing. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format. For example, a voucher with the value of P24D will be valid for a duration of 24 days.

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to. Either pass this parameter OR the `category`.

category.description: The category assigned to the campaign. Either pass this parameter OR the `category_id`.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the campaign. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a campaign object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the campaign in a structured format.

CodeConfig.title: Code Config
CodeConfig.description: Contains information about the config used for the voucher code. Defines the code's pattern (prefix, postfix, length, charset, etc).

length.description: Number of characters in a generated code (excluding prefix and postfix).

charset.description:
Characters that can appear in the code.  

Examples:

- Alphanumeric: `0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Alphabetic: `abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Alphabetic Lowercase: `abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz` 
- Alphabetic Uppercase: `ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Numbers: `0123456789`  
- Custom: a custom character set

prefix.description: A text appended before the code.

postfix.description: A text appended after the code.

pattern.description: A pattern for codes where hashes (#) will be replaced with random characters. Overrides `length`.

initial_count.description: Internal value, does not change anything if provided.

banner.description: Text to be displayed to your customers on your website.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the promotion tier. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a promotion tier object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the promotion tier in a structured format.

hierarchy.description: The promotions hierarchy defines the order in which the discounts from different tiers will be applied to a customer's order. If a customer qualifies for discounts from more than one tier, discounts will be applied in the order defined in the hierarchy.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the promotion tier on or off. You can disable a promotion tier even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* promotion tier
- `false` indicates an *inactive* promotion tier

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier expires in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive after* this date.

category.description: Assign a new or update the promotion tier's category using name.

category_id.description: Assign a new or update the promotion tier's category using id

PromotionTier.description: This is an object representing a promotion tier. Promotion tiers are always assigned to a campaign and cannot be used standalone.
PromotionTier.title: Promotion Tier

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the promotion tier was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the promotion tier was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

banner.description: Text to be displayed to your customers on your website.

action.description: Contains details about the discount applied by the promotion tier.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the promotion tier. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a promotion tier object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the promotion tier in a structured format.

hierarchy.description: The promotions hierarchy defines the order in which the discounts from different tiers will be applied to a customer's order. If a customer qualifies for discounts from more than one tier, discounts will be applied in the order defined in the hierarchy.

campaign.description: Contains details about promotion tier's parent campaign.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag indicating whether the campaign is active or not active. A campaign can be disabled even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date` using the <!-- [Disable Campaign](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1campaigns~1{campaignId}~1disable) -->[Disable Campaign](ref:disable-campaign) endpoint.  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the campaign object. This object stores information about the campaign.

campaign_id.description: Promotion tier's parent campaign's unique ID.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the promotion tier on or off. You can disable a promotion tier even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* promotion tier
- `false` indicates an *inactive* promotion tier

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier expires in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive after* this date.

summary.description: Contains statistics about promotion tier redemptions and orders.

redemptions.description: Contains statistics about promotion tier redemptions.

total_redeemed.description: Number of times the promotion tier was redeemed.

orders.description: Contains statistics about orders related to the promotion tier.

total_discount_amount.description: Sum of total discount applied using the promotion tier.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the promotion tier.

ValidityTimeframe.title: Validity Timeframe
ValidityTimeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the earning rule is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time an earning rule will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, an earning rule with a `duration` of `PT1H` will be valid for a duration of one hour.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, an earning rule with an `interval` of `P2D` will be valid every other day.

ValidityDayOfWeek.title: Validity Day Of Week
ValidityDayOfWeek.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the voucher is valid.

- `0` Sunday
- `1` Monday
- `2` Tuesday
- `3` Wednesday
- `4` Thursday
- `5` Friday
- `6` Saturday

ValidityHours.title: Validity Hours
ValidityHours.description: Determines the hours of validity, e.g. to create a happy hours scenario.

daily.description: Defines the reccuring period(s) when the resource is active. The periods should not overlap.

items.description: Defines the reccuring period(s) when the resource will be active.

start_time.description: Defines the starting hour of validity in the HH:mm format. The resource is *inactive before* this time.

days_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the resource is valid.

- `0` Sunday
- `1` Monday
- `2` Tuesday
- `3`  Wednesday
- `4` Thursday
- `5` Friday
- `6` Saturday

expiration_time.description: Defines the ending hour of validity in the HH:mm format. The resource is *inactive after* this time.

AccessSettings.title: Access Settings
AccessSettings.description:
Assigns or unassigns an area or store to the campaign.

**NOTE**: this object can be sent if the Areas and Stores enterprise feature is enabled. Contact [Voucherify Sales](https://www.voucherify.io/contact-sales) to learn more.

assign.description:
Assigns the campaign to an area or a store. Provide the area and/or store IDs in the respective arrays. If a campaign changes assignments between areas or stores, unassign it from the area. For example, if a campaign is assigned to Area-01, but it must be now assigned to Store-01 within this area, you have to unassign the campaign from Area-01 and assign to Store-01 only.

If you want to assign the campaign to stores only, you do not have to send the area ID.

areas_ids.description: List all area IDs to which the campaign will be assigned.

area_stores_ids.description: List all store IDs to which the campaign will be assigned.

area_all_stores_ids.description: List all area IDs where the campaign is assigned to all stores in the area. This assignment is not equal to the assignment to all `area_stores_ids` listed separately.

unassign.description:
Unassigns the campaign from an area or a store. Provide the area and/or store IDs in the respective arrays. If a campaign changes assignments between areas or stores, unassign it first. For example, if a campaign is assigned to Area-01, but it must be now assigned to Store-01 within this area, you have to unassign the campaign from Area-01 and assigned to Store-01 only.

If you want to assign the campaign to stores only, you do not have to send the area ID.

areas_ids.description: List all area IDs from which the campaign will be unassigned.

area_stores_ids.description: List all store IDs from which the campaign will be unassigned.

area_all_stores_ids.description: List all area IDs where the campaign will be unassigned from all stores in the area. This unassignment is not equal to the unassignment from all `area_stores_ids` listed separately.

CampaignBase.title: Campaign Base
CampaignBase.description: This is an object representing a campaign.

id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

description.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the campaign such as a campaign description and details.

type.description:
Defines whether the campaign can be updated with new vouchers after campaign creation or if the campaign consists of generic (standalone) voucherss.

- `AUTO_UPDATE`: the campaign is dynamic, i.e. vouchers will generate based on set criteria
-  `STATIC`: vouchers need to be manually published
- `STANDALONE`: campaign for single vouchers

auto_join.description: Indicates whether customers will be able to auto-join a loyalty campaign if any earning rule is fulfilled.

join_once.description: If this value is set to `true`, customers will be able to join the campaign only once. It is always `false` for generic (standalone) vouchers campaigns and it cannot be changed in them. It is always `true` for loyalty campaigns and it cannot be changed in them.

use_voucher_metadata_schema.description: Flag indicating whether the campaign is to use the voucher's metadata schema instead of the campaign metadata schema.

activity_duration_after_publishing.description: Defines the amount of time the vouchers will be active after publishing. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format. For example, a voucher with the value of P24D will be valid for a duration of 24 days.

vouchers_count.description: Total number of unique vouchers in campaign.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the campaign on or off. You can disable a campaign even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the campaign. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a campaign object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the campaign in a structured format.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

creation_status.description: Indicates the status of the campaign creation.

vouchers_generation_status.description: Indicates the status of the campaign's voucher generation.

readonly.description: Indicates whether the campaign can be only read by a restricted user in the Areas and Stores enterprise feature. It is returned only to restricted users; this field is not returned for users with other roles. It is also not returned for restricted users who use the [GET Campaign summary](ref:campaign-summary) endpoint.

protected.description: Indicates whether the resource can be deleted.

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to.

categories.description: Contains details about the campaign category. For the GET [List campaigns](ref:list-campaigns) endpoint, this is returned only if the `expand=category` query parameter is passed in the request. Otherwise, it is returned as an empty array. For GET [Campaign summary](ref:get-campaign-summary) endpoint, it is always returned as an empty array.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the campaign.
The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about promotion tiers in a dictionary.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of promotion tier objects.

tiers.description: Contains array of promotion tier objects.

has_more.description: As query results are always limited (by the limit parameter), the `has_more` flag indicates if there are more records for given filter parameters. This lets you know if you can run another request to get more records returned in the results.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about validation rules assignments.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of validation rules assignments.

data.description: Contains array of validation rules assignments.

total.description: Total number of validation rules assignments.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about validation rule assignments.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the JSON property that contains the array of validation rule assignments.

data.description: A dictionary that contains an array of validation rule assignments.

total.description: Total number of validation rule assignments.

Category.title: Category
Category.description: This is an object representing a category.

id.description: Unique category ID assigned by Voucherify.

hierarchy.description: Category hierarchy. Categories with lower hierarchy are processed before categories with higher hierarchy value.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the category.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the category was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the category was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

CampaignVoucher.description: Schema model for a campaign voucher.
CampaignVoucher.title: Campaign Voucher

discount.description: Defines the voucher discount type and details.

loyalty_card.description: Defines the voucher loyalty card details.

redemption.description: Defines the redemption limits on vouchers.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

is_referral_code.description: Flag indicating whether this voucher is a referral code; `true` for campaign type `REFERRAL_PROGRAM`.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

ReferralProgram.title: Referral Program
ReferralProgram.description: Defines the referee reward and the way a referral is triggered. Context: `REFERRAL_PROGRAM`.

conversion_event_type.description: Define how a referral is triggered.

custom_event.description: Contains details about the custom event.

related_object_parent.description: Details of the resource from which the reward originates.

id.description: Unique ID of the reward source.

object.description: Type of resource represented by the source of the reward.

amount.description: Define the number of `points` to add to a loyalty card or `credits` to the balance on a gift card. In case of the gift card, the value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

qualification_type.description:
Tier qualification.   

`BALANCE`: Points balance is based on the customer's current points balance. Customers qualify for the tier if their points balance is in the points range of the tier. 
 `POINTS_IN_PERIOD`: A customer qualifies for the tier only if the sum of the accumulated points in a **defined time interval** reaches the tier threshold.

qualification_period.description:
Customers can qualify for the tier if they collected enough points in a given time period. So, in addition to the customer having to reach a points range, they also need to have collected the points within a set time period. | **Period** | **Definition** | |:---|:---| | **Calendar Month** | Points collected in one calendar month
January, February, March, etc. | | **Calendar Quarter** | Points collected in the quarter
- January - March
- April - June
- July - September
- October - December | | **Calendar Half-year** | Points collected in the half-year
- January - June
- July - December | | **Calendar Year** | Points collected in one calendar year
January - December |

start_date.description: Defines the conditions for the start date of the tier.

type.description:
What triggers the tier to be valid for a customer.    
`IMMEDIATE`: After reaching the minimum required points. 
`NEXT_PERIOD`: When the next qualification period starts.

expiration_date.description: Defines the conditions for the expiration date of a tier.

type.description:
What triggers the tier to expire for a customer.    
`END_OF_PERIOD`: Expire tier at the end of the period.    
`END_OF_NEXT_PERIOD`:  Expire tier at the end of the next period. 
 `BALANCE_DROP`: Tier expires when the points balance drops below the required range of the tier. 
 `CUSTOM`: Tier expires after a certain time period passes following the instance the points balance drops below the required range of the tier.

extend.description: Extend the expiration by adding extra months or days in ISO 8601 format. The tier will remain active even though it reaches its expiration time period. For example, a tier with a duration of `P3M` will be valid for an additional duration of 3 months and a tier with a duration of `P1D` will be valid for an additional duration of 1 day.

rounding.description: Defines the rounding mechanism for tier expiration.

type.description: This mechanism describes a custom rounding for the expiration date.

strategy.description: This mechanism describes a rounding strategy for the expiration date.

unit.description: Defines the type of unit of time in which the rounding period is counted.

value.description:
Value for the unit of time that the rounding applies to. Units for this parameter are defined by the `rounding.unit` parameter.    
- `0`: January
- `1`: February
- `2`: March
- `3`: April
- `4`: May
- `5`: June
- `6`: July
- `7`: August
- `8`: September
- `9`: October
- `10`: November
- `11`: December

AccessSettingsCampaignAssignmentsList.title: Access Settings Campaign Assignments List
AccessSettingsCampaignAssignmentsList.description:
Lists all assignments of the campaign to areas and stores. For [GET List Campaigns](ref:list-campaigns), this is returned if the `expand=access_settings_assignments` query parameter is passed in the request. This object is not returned for the [GET Campaign summary endpoint](ref:get-campaign-summary).

**NOTE**: This object is returned only if the Areas and Stores enterprise feature is enabled. Contact [Voucherify Sales](https://www.voucherify.io/contact-sales) to learn more.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. Default is `list`. This object stores information about campaign assignments to areas and stores

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of campaign assignments.

data.description: Contains an array of campaign assignments.

total.description: Total number of areas and stores to which the campaign is assigned.

id.description: The unique identifier for a assignment

rule_id.description: The unique identifier for a rule

related_object_id.description: The unique identifier for a related object

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

validation_status.description: The validation status of the assignment

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

amount_off.description: Amount taken off the subtotal of a price. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount.

unit_off_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the number of units.

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from product inventory (e.g. time, items).

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

percent_off.description: The percent discount that the customer will receive.

amount_limit.description: Upper limit allowed to be applied as a discount. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount is written as 600.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

fixed_amount.description: Sets a fixed value for an order total or the item price. The value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000. If the fixed amount is calculated by the formula, i.e. the `fixed_amount_formula` parameter is present in the fixed amount definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. As a result, if the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed value.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

ValidationRuleAssignment.title: Validation Rule Assignment
ValidationRuleAssignment.description: This is an object representing a validation rule assignment.

related_object_id.description: The resource ID to which the validation rule was assigned.

related_object_type.description: The type of resource to which the validation rule was assigned.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the validation rule assignment was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the ID.

Gift.title: Gift
Gift.description: Contains current gift card balance information.

amount.description: Total gift card income over the lifetime of the card. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtracted_amount.description: Total amount of subtracted credits over the gift card lifetime.

balance.description: Available funds. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`. `balance` = `amount` - `subtracted_amount` - `redemption.redeemed_amount`.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order.

CampaignLoyaltyCard.description: Schema model for a campaign loyalty card.
CampaignLoyaltyCard.title: Campaign Loyalty Card

points.description: The initial number of points to assign to the loyalty card. This is the current loyalty card score i.e. the number of loyalty points on the card.

expiration_rules.description: Defines the loyalty point expiration rule. This expiration rule applies when there are no `expiration_rules` defined for an earning rule.

period_type.description: Type of period. Can be set for `MONTH` or `FIXED_DAY_OF_YEAR`. `MONTH` requires the `period_value` field. `FIXED_DAY_OF_YEAR` requires the `fixed_month` and `fixed_day` fields.

period_value.description: Value of the period. Required for the `period_type: MONTH`.

rounding_type.description: Type of rounding of the expiration period. Optional for the `period_type: MONTH`.

rounding_value.description: Value of rounding of the expiration period. Required for the `rounding_type`.

fixed_month.description: Determines the month when the points expire; `1` is January, `2` is February, and so on. Required for the `period_type: FIXED_DAY_OF_YEAR`.

fixed_day.description: Determines the day of the month when the points expire. Required for the `period_type: FIXED_DAY_OF_YEAR`.

AreaStoreCampaignAssignment.title: Areas and Stores Campain Assignment
AreaStoreCampaignAssignment.description: An object representing an assignment of a campaign to an area or store.

id.description: Unique identifier of the campaign assignment.

area_id.description: Unique identifier of the area to which the campaign is assigned.

all_stores.description: Determines if the campaign is assigned to all of the stores in the area, i.e. if an area ID is passed in the `access_settings.assign.area_all_stores_ids` in the request.

area_store_id.description: Unique identifier of the store to which the campaign is assigned.

created_at.description: Date and time when the assignment was made. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the campaign assignment to areas or stores.

id.description: Unique product ID, assigned by Voucherify.
Unique SKU ID, assigned by Voucherify.

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount.

unit_off_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the number of units.

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from product inventory (e.g. time, items).
